data.title: Add ability to set "keep screen on" for android & iOS. fixes #2428
data.body:
Can change "Set Keep Screen On" at Project settings.

2 methods are added to `OS`.

```
OS::set_keep_screen_on(bool)
bool OS::is_keep_screen_on()
```

data.title: Fix help view not scrolling to the top
data.body:
Fixes the following issue:

Search "Node" and open "Node (Class)" result in _Search Help_ dialog. You will get the following error:

```
ERROR: scroll_to_line: Index p_line out of size (lines.size()).
   At: scene/gui/rich_text_label.cpp:1508.
```

If the help view for this class was already open, it won't scroll to the top.

data.title: Fix RichTextLabel selection copying
data.body: Fixes #2971

data.title: label material _notification causes segfault on exit
data.body:
To reproduce:
Add a label to a scene.  Add a material to the label, and add a script to the material.  If you run right now, it's fine.  If you add:

func _notification(what):
    pass

to the script, it'll segfault when you exit the window.  I test with 
/path/to/godot.x11.tools.64 -path /path/to/project

data.title: Add enums to GDScript
data.body:
### TL;DR

I would like to avoid writing

``` js
const CORNER_W  = 0
const CORNER_NW = 1
const CORNER_NE = 2
const CORNER_E  = 3
const CORNER_SE = 4
const CORNER_SW = 5
```

And be able to write it like:

``` js
enum {CORNER_W, CORNER_NW, CORNER_NE, CORNER_E, CORNER_SE, CORNER_SW}
```

---
### Some more ideas

Those ideas might simplify the usual workflow, or add additional features for strange workflows or setups.

Nice addition to avoid repetition:

``` js
enum CORNER_{W, NW, NE, E, SE, SW}
```

Custom values idea 1:

``` js
enum {CORNER_W = 1, CORNER_NW = 2, CORNER_NE = 3, CORNER_E = 4, CORNER_SE = 5, CORNER_SW = 6}
enum {CORNER_W = 4, CORNER_NW, CORNER_NE, CORNER_E, CORNER_SE, CORNER_SW}
```

Custom values idea 2:

``` js
enum {CORNER_W, CORNER_NW, CORNER_NE, CORNER_E, CORNER_SE, CORNER_SW} = [1,2,3,4,5,6]
enum {CORNER_W, CORNER_NW, CORNER_NE, CORNER_E, CORNER_SE, CORNER_SW} = range(1,7)
```

Maybe `enum` should be prefixed by `const` or `var` depending on use? (IMO, it would be better to assume `const`, as to not create ambiguities, and/or hard to understand code)

``` js
const enum {…}
var enum {…}
```

data.title: build error for android x86 in drivers/opus/silk (no such instruction: `smulbb %eax,%eax,%ebp')
data.body:
```
scons -j 4 p=android target=release android_arch=x86
```

```
#!/bin/sh
cd godot

export ANDROID_NDK_ROOT=/home/alexey/Android/android-ndk-r10d/
export ANDROID_HOME=/home/alexey/Android/Sdk/

# git does not allow empty dirs, so create those
mkdir -p platform/android/java/libs/armeabi
mkdir -p platform/android/java/libs/x86
mkdir -p ../templates

#Android Release

#scons -j 4 p=android target=release
scons -j 4 p=android target=release android_arch=x86

cp bin/libgodot.android.opt.armv7.neon.so platform/android/java/libs/armeabi/libgodot_android.so
cp bin/libgodot.android.opt.x86.so platform/android/java/libs/x86/libgodot_android.so

ant -s platform/android/java/build.xml release

cp platform/android/java/bin/Godot-release-unsigned.apk ../templates/android_release.apk
```

![builr_e_and_x86](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/233268/11485753/105a53ac-97c6-11e5-8738-ab16d6b80762.jpg)

ndk : android-ndk-r10d

data.title: Import dae file failed with skeleton and mesh skin, Also failed with skeleton animation
data.body:
Hi,

Currently, I want to use fbx(mesh with skeleton animation, created by Maya) in godot。
But import failed with dae file exported by OpenCollada plugin with Maya--2011.
 https://github.com/KhronosGroup/OpenCOLLADA/wiki/OpenCOLLADA-Tools

I create some samples:
https://drive.google.com/folderview?id=0B4YTkPLUt69iZ2RsZjlLblhhLU0&usp=sharing

The sample list as follows:
    1) onlymesh.dae-----Sphere
    Result:  both works in godot and unity with import 3d scene 
    2)onemesh onjoint.dae-- one mesh with two joints, so one skeleton
    Result: both works in godot and unity.
   3)onemesh onjoint skin.dae -- one mesh, two joints, with skin
   Result: godot import error
  4)onemesh onjoint animation.dae -- one mesh, two joints, with skin and skeleton animation
   Result: godot import error, unity import , but can not play skeleton animation

  Also, as I saw the notes somewhere:
        make sure that
        -meshes are child of skeleton
       -mesh transform (offset, rotation, scale) in regards to skeleton is zero

I create samples with skeleton as mesh's parent:
    1)onemesh onjoint parent.dae-- make skeleton as mesh's parent in Maya 2011
       Result: both works in godot and unity
   2)onemesh onjoint parent skin.dae-- one mesh, two joints, with skin, make skeleton as mesh parent
       Result:godot can import,but no mesh,only skeleton Nodes. Unity works well
   3)onemesh onjoint parent animation.dae
      Result: not works.

Many thanks if you could help.

Best Wishes,
Fengwei.

data.title: Inherited Scenes that also inherit from the same .gd class can't hold default values in exported variables
data.body:
The bug was reproduced in 222d112f496a5193b837854a72e4025a45a28ef2 build, but with manually reversed fix from: https://github.com/godotengine/godot/commit/884d5a0f41032a9c5c793577b82998998b3f87a0 since with this fix it's not possible to use Inherited Scenes feature at all.
1. You have BaseScene.xscn that has a script "BaseScript.gd".
2. You have a scene "ExtendedScene.xscn" that inherit from BaseScene.xscn and have a "ExtendedScript.gd" script that inherit from BaseScript.gd.
3. If in BaseScript.gd you will have any exported variable you wont be able to hold in "ExtendedScene.xscn" default value of this variable.

Video for quick judge:
https://youtu.be/JgwUxxqv7KE
Sample project: 
https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/168251/godot/InheritedSceneAndPropertyLost.7z

data.title: GDScript: fixed highlighting of the next line when colon is missing
data.body: At the moment when colon is missing at the end of if- or func-line the next line is being highlighted in the debugger. This may be quite confusing as the actual error is on the previous line.

data.title: scons: enabled debug symbols for x11 when using platform=release_debug and debug_release=yes together
data.body:
Currently debug_release=yes affects target=release, but not target=release_debug.
This combination is handy, as one can use it run projects with decent performance and still being able to use debugger.

data.title: Edit documentation for AABB and Rect2.
data.body: Also ran -doctool.

data.title: KinematicBody (3D) moves wrong when its parent's translation is not (0,0,0)
data.body:
Let say we have:
- a spatial as the world
- a static body as the map 
- a kinematic body as the player

The player collides with the map with the method move(motion), so it doesn't get through walls and the ground. If the root node, the world, has a translation = (0,0,0), everything is fine. But if it has a translation (x,y,z), everytime the player enters in collision with the map, for instance at the landing of a jump, the player suddenly moves with the translation of its parent, the world. So, if the world has a translation (1,0,0), the move method from the kinematic body will add this (1,0,0) to the kinematic body, but only when it detects a new collision with something else. This bug doesn't happens when there was already a collision (like standing on the ground because of gravity) or when there's no collision (falling or flying).

Also if the kinematic body has multiple parents, the sum of the parents' translation is the distance the body will move. Therefore it moves according to the absolute translation of the immediat parent of the kinematic body. Adding an intermediate spatial node with translation=(0,0,0) is useless. And setting the root node's translation to (0,0,0) doesn't matter either if one parent of the kinematic body has a translation not (0,0,0).

The obvious workaround is to insure that every parent of kinematic nodes has a translation = (0,0,0). But it can be quite inconvenient, especially for mobs.

data.title: tscn/tres: Can't open tileset source scene nor use exported tileset resource in tscn/tres formats
data.body:
I can't say for sure that this is related to tilesets, or if it's just that my tileset scene happens to use a feature that the tscn/tres parser does not handle properly.

To reproduce the issue, you can clone: https://github.com/akien-mga/dynadungeons

There is already a scenes/tileset.tscn file there that Godot is not able to open. Alternatively, you can open scenes/tileset.xscn and save it as .tscn, it should produce the exact same non-usable file.

Regarding the resources, sprites/tileset.xml was saved as sprites/tileset.tres, and the latter does not work when trying to load it in-game (change the resource path in scenes/level.tscn to test).
Reexporting the tileset from scenes/tileset.xscn to a new sprites/tileset.tres produces the exact same result, so at least the conversions seem to work fine, but the format is not OK for the engine.

data.title: tscn format is missing from the filesystem panel
data.body:
Scenes saved in the tscn format do not appear in the filesystem panel. A potentially related issue is that they do not appear either in the "Quick Open Scene" (Ctrl + Shift + O) dialog. On the other hand they appear fine in the "Open Scene" dialog (Ctrl + O).

If the main scene is a tscn file, it seems however to appear fine in the filesystem.
_Edit:_ Actually no, tscn files appear in the filesystem if they have been saved once during the session.

![tscn-fs](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4701338/11456596/6e762832-968e-11e5-9d47-686cafb57587.png)
![tscn-fs1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4701338/11456601/849c5aaa-968e-11e5-9da5-3b010291a049.png)
![tscn-fs2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4701338/11456602/86ac64d4-968e-11e5-9a0d-e4f1ea8197c3.png)
